1. Revised legislation and technical guidelines for mainstreaming biodiversity conservation in natural resource use sectors and Biosphere Reserves management are developed. - The revised Law on Environmental Protection 2020 was adopted. - The decree for BR management, the BR strategy and the circular concerning guidance to implement some articles of revised Law on Environmental Protection 2020 have been developed for approval in Q1 2022. 2. Functional governance and coordination mechanism are established at national level to support dialogue, information flow and decision-making between provinces and national levels for facilitating integrated planning and management of Biosphere Reserves. The PMU was established at the central level and 3 Planning and Implementation Teams (PITs) were established at 3 sites for governance and coordination functions of the project. Besides, the cooperation and information sharing mechanism between BRs and related stakeholders are integrated in BR legal document, strategy and guidelines to improve the information flow and experience sharing between BRs and related stakeholders.
3. National strategy for BR management for 2021 – 2021 is developed (including action plan and BR advocacy strategy). National strategy for BR management has been developed for approval in Q1/2022 4. Multi-stakeholder and multi-sectoral coordination mechanism at Biosphere Reserve level to support integrated planning and management are established. The multi-stakeholder and multi-sectoral mechanism is prority approach to be integrated and applied for developing project outputs and implementing project activities. Those approaches are integrated and mainstreaming in dafts of BR legal document, BR strategy (period 2021-2030) and related technical guidelines (BR nomination and management guidelines, guideline to integrate biodiversity targets in provincial plan…), the 5. Assessment and mapping of biological, socio-economic, environmental and institutional aspects in 3 BRs are conducted.
The mapping processes were completed in Tay Nghe An BR from Q2 2021 and they are expected to be completed in Cu Lao Cham – Hoi An BR and Dong Nai BR in Q1 2022 due to covid-19’s impacts. All mapping outputs were developed and being revised for final approval.
6. Set-asides for at least 60,000ha. 4,000ha of forest restoration areas and priority communes for CCP activities are identified for implementation of conservation plans, forest restoration plans and CCPs in 3BRs.
- Completed: The mapping process identified total 63,698.30ha set-aside areas in three BRs (Dong Nai BR: 22,209ha; Cu Lao Cham - Hoi An BR: 731.66ha ; Tay Nghe An BR: 40,757.64ha). 4,489.34 ha of degraded forest in 3 BRs were identifed for restoration activities (including: Dong Nai BR: 2,212.23ha; Cu Lao Cham - Hoi An: 260ha; Tay Nghe An BR 2,017.11ha).
7. Sustainable forest management plans (SFMP) and annual operation plans for six Pas are developed to submit for approval and implementation. The sustainable forest management plans are developing for NPs/ NRs in Cu Lao Cham and Tay Nghe An BRs. The SFMPs of Cat Tien NP and Dong Nai NR were approved using co-financing budgets. Annual operation plans 2021 for six NPs/PAs are developing and revising for approval.
8. IBMA Plan through the approved of BR management plans of 3BRs are developed. The consultant firms were recruited for Dong Nai and Tay Nghe An BR from Dec 2021 (it is expected from Feb 2022 in Cu Lao Cham – Hoi An BR) to develop BR management plans that are integrated IBMA. Those BR Management plans are expected to be completed in Q3 2022.
9. Biodiversity/ key endangered species monitoring plans in 3BRs are developed and implemented. The biodiversity and targeted species monitoring was conducted in 3 BRs in 2021
10. Investment plans to adjacent communities to reduce threats and improve sustainable resource use for set-aside areas in Dong Nai and Tay Nghe An BRs are developed for implementation.
The mapping processes were completed in 3 BRs that identified a total of 63,698.30ha of set-aside areas in 3 BR (including 22,209ha in Dong Nai BR; 731.66ha in Cu Lao Cham – Hoi An BR; and 40,757.64ha in Tay Nghe An BR). The plans for non-exhausted use of natural resources for set-aside areas in 3 BRs are developing by the national consultantsfor implementing.
11. Forest restoration and protection plans for degraded forest areas in 3BRs are developed for implementing. The mapping process were completed in 3 BRs that identified 4,489.34 ha of degraded forest. The forest restoration and protection plans for degrated forest areas in 3 BRs are under developing and will be completed in Q2 2022.
12. Implementation of improved and alternative livelihoods, sustainable resource management and best practice approaches in 3BRs. 2 livelihood improvement projects have been approved by UNDP-GEF/SGP and signed contracts for implementation in Tay Nghe An BR. The implementation will commence in January 2022 with expected 996 household beneficiaries, among which 50% of direct beneficiaries are women. The implementation will last for 24 months. 13. Ecotourism development guidelines, tourism resources evaluations and tourism development plans for 3BRs developed for implementation. Ecotourism development guidelines for 3 BRs are developing and they are expected to be completed in Q2 and Q3 2022. Tourism resources evaluations are conducting in Dong Nai and Tay Nghe An BRs that will be completed in Q2 2022 (and it is expected to be conducted in Cu Lao Cham – Hoi An from Q1 2022). 14. Training needs assessment, capacity building plan for BRs and training materials are conducted. Consultants will be recruited to conduct training need assessment and develop capacity building plan for BRs from Q1 2022.
